snippet: The pullout, under the terms of a deal that gives the district to government forces, is a bitter defeat for the insurgents.
abstract: Syrian rebels agree to leave the Old City of Homs, one of the first cities in Syria to hold large demonstrations against Pres Bashar al-Assad and the first to suffer indiscriminate bombardment by government forces; deal does little to head off the fragmentation of the country as both sides continue to refuse a broad negotiated settlement to a war that has taken more than 150,000 lives.

byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon contributed reporting from Washington, and Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad from Beirut.

lead_paragraph: The pullout, under the terms of a deal that gives the district to government forces, is a bitter defeat for the insurgents.

headline.main: Syrian Rebels Depart Homs District Under Deal
headline.print_headline: Syrian Rebels Agree to Leave a Stronghold

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
